verses.text: Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*. Praise ye the name of the \sc Lord\sc*; Praise \add him\add*, O ye servants of the \sc Lord\sc*.
Ye that stand in the house of the \sc Lord\sc*, In the courts of the house of our God,
Praise the \sc Lord\sc*; for the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* good: Sing \add praises\add* unto his name; for \add it is\add* pleasant.
For the \sc Lord\sc* hath chosen Jacob unto himself, \add And\add* Israel for his peculiar treasure.
For I know that the \sc Lord\sc* \add is\add* great, And \add that\add* our Lord \add is\add* above all gods.
Whatsoever the \sc Lord\sc* pleased, \add That\add* did he in heaven, and in earth, In the seas, and all deep places.
He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; He maketh lightnings for the rain; He bringeth the wind out of his treasuries.
Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, Both of man and beast.
\add Who\add* sent tokens and wonders into the midst of thee, O Egypt, Upon Pharaoh, and upon all his servants.
Who smote great nations, And slew mighty kings;
Sihon king of the Amorites, And Og king of Bashan, And all the kingdoms of Canaan:
And gave their land \add for\add* an heritage, An heritage unto Israel his people.
Thy name, O \sc Lord\sc*, \add endureth\add* for ever; \add And\add* thy memorial, O \sc Lord\sc*, throughout all generations.
For the \sc Lord\sc* will judge his people, And he will repent himself concerning his servants.
The idols of the heathen \add are\add* silver and gold, The work of menâ€™s hands.
They have mouths, but they speak not; Eyes have they, but they see not;
They have ears, but they hear not; Neither is there \add any\add* breath in their mouths.
They that make them are like unto them: \add So is\add* every one that trusteth in them.
Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, O house of Israel: Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, O house of Aaron:
Bless the \sc Lord\sc*, O house of Levi: Ye that fear the \sc Lord\sc*, bless the \sc Lord\sc*.
Blessed \add be\add* the \sc Lord\sc* out of Zion, which dwelleth \add at\add* Jerusalem. Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*.
